title: 'Desperate' Thunder get even, rout Nuggets by 43
content: Unwilling to fall into a 2-0 series hole, the Thunder put on a clinic in Game 2, scoring an NBA playoff record 87 points in the first half en route to beating the Nuggets 149-106.

title: Knicks 'finding ways to win,' go up 2-0 on Celtics
content: Mikal Bridges scored all of his 14 points in the fourth quarter before making his second straight game-clinching steal, and the Knicks overcame a 20-point deficit again to beat the Celtics 91-90 on Wednesday for a 2-0 lead in the second-round series.

title: Curry to miss at least a week as Warriors 'adapt'
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry will miss at least one week of the playoffs after he was diagnosed with a Grade 1 left hamstring strain.

title: Finch asks NBA to review Dubs' 'shots at' Gobert
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch said his team submitted clips to the league office that showed what he believes was egregious contact made against center Rudy Gobert in Minnesota's 99-88 Game 1 loss.

title: Stanton: Could rejoin Yankees when first eligible
content: Giancarlo Stanton (elbows) said he could return to the Yankees lineup by the end of the month, when he's first eligible.

title: Red-hot Rantanen sets records with G1 hat trick
content: The Stars' Mikko Rantanen stayed hot in Wednesday's Game 1, as his three-goal blitz in the second period made him the first player in Stanley Cup playoff history with multiple three-goal periods in the same postseason.

title: Cease loses no-hit bid, exits with forearm cramp
content: Moments after losing a no-hit bid in the seventh inning, San Diego Padres pitcher Dylan Cease left his start against the New York Yankees because of a cramp in his right forearm.

title: USWNT star Mallory Swanson expecting first child
content: United States forward Mallory Swanson is expecting her first child with husband Dansby Swanson, shortstop for the Chicago Cubs.

title: 📷Inside Saquon Barkley's night at the Met Gala
content: On fashion's biggest night, ESPN goes behind the scenes with the Super Bowl champion and Philadelphia Eagles star.

title: Are the Orioles blowing their contention window? What we can learn from other stacked young teams
content: The path from the top of the prospect rankings to the World Series isn't always a straight line. Here's what the O's can learn from others who have tried to walk it.

title: We graded both sides of the George Pickens trade: How the Cowboys, Steelers fared in the WR move
content: Pickens is headed to Dallas for draft picks. Did the Cowboys solve their WR2 problem -- and did the Steelers create one? Let's size up the move.

title: Arsenal can't shake nearly-men tag as PSG's collective wins out
content: Paris Saint-Germain will get a second chance to heal their 2020 Champions League final heartbreak, where more soul-searching will occur at Arsenal.

title: NFL draft nuggets for every team's rookie class: Exec reaction, draft room maneuvers, remaining needs
content: With the draft dust having settled, we canvassed the league on the biggest decisions and most surprising picks.

title: Experts debate the draft: Who are the early favorites for Rookie of the Year?
content: We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the draft with their top picks, best classes and Rookie of the Year picks.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: Why Man City are making the right call to let De Bruyne go
content: It might sting Kevin de Bruyne and his fans that his time at Man City is coming to an end this summer, but it's the right call for both club and player.

title: Inter Milan, Barcelona write new chapter in UCL folklore
content: Inter's 7-6 aggregate defeat of Barça will go down as one of the Champions League's best-ever set of games.

title: PSG coach revels in 'league of farmers' final spot
content: Luis Enrique mocked Ligue 1's status as a "farmers league" after Paris Saint-Germain sealed a place in the Champions League final with a 3-1 semifinal aggregate win against Arsenal

title: Police seize Maradona's medical records in raid
content: Police carried out an overnight raid at a Buenos Aires health clinic to seize Diego Maradona's complete medical records following a court order during the trial of seven health care professionals accused of negligence in the former soccer star's death.

title: Maracanã among 8 Brazil stadiums for 2027 WWC
content: FIFA president Gianni Infantino announced on Wednesday the eight host cities for the 2027 FIFA Women's World Cup in Brazil.

title: Ange responds to Wenger: We make people crazy
content: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou has hit back at Arsene Wenger's suggestion that the winner of the Europa League should not automatically qualify for the Champions League.

title: Azteca to reopen in March for 2026 World Cup
content: Mexico City's Mayor Clara Brugada announced on Wednesday that the renowned Azteca Stadium will reopen in March 2026 after renovations to meet FIFA standards for hosting the 2026 World Cup.

title: Garnacho 'happy' at Man Utd despite transfer links
content: Alejandro Garnacho has said he's "happy" at Manchester United despite continued speculation about his future.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Clásico, how could his last few weeks play out? And what's next for him and Real Madrid?

title: Bellingham ruled last season's Clásicos. Can he save Madrid's title hopes vs. Barça?
content: It's been a challenging season for Jude Bellingham, but the title-deciding Clásico is the perfect stage for him.

title: How Golden State wins without Steph: Playoff Jimmy to the rescue?
content: Steph Curry's hamstring strain is a big blow, but the Warriors' addition of Butler gives them a fighting chance.

title: Grading how every men's ACC basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: How should UNC's campaign be judged? What about the conference's newest members? Our verdicts on all 18 teams.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: André Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Everything to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: Betting buzz: Curry injury shifts Warriors-Timberwolves Game 2 line five points
content: As oddsmakers continue to monitor Stephen Curry's hamstring strain, the Warriors' odds to win Game 2 against the Timberwolves have moved dramatically.

title: Which players should Chelsea sign? Plus: All you need to know about Estêvão, Essugo, other arrivals
content: Chelsea have spent over €1.6 billion on transfers in the past few years, mainly on young players, so who should they target next? And who is arriving already?

title: Five players you need to trade for right now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at some players who have started slowly that he expects to turn things around quickly.

title: Stock watch: Shelby Miller for saves?
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Doohan out, Colapinto in: Instability impedes Alpine ambition
content: Alpine has swapped drivers and lost a team principal this week, instability that will keep it down F1's order.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India-UK Trade Deal Shows Globalisation Is Ticking Along
content: President Donald Trump may say "tariffs" are his favorite word, but the rest of the world doesn't have to agree. With or without America, trade deals continue to be signed.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India Foils Pakistan's Bid To Target Military Infra In 15 Cities
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces foiled attempts by the Pakistani military to engage a number of military targets across 15 cities in Northern and Western India using drones and missiles on Thursday night, the Centre said.

title: Brother's Hug, "Integrity" Advice: Former, Incoming Chief Justices' Bonhomie
content: Chief Justice of India-designate Justice BR Gavai praised his predecessor Justice NV Ramana for his vision in making justice accessible.

title: Accused Mushroom Murderer Sent Children To Movies Before Deadly Meal
content: An Australian woman accused of triple murder sent her children to the movies before serving up a toxic mushroom lunch that killed her guests, a court heard on Thursday.

title: Read India's Full Statement On Neutralising Pakistan Missile Attack
content: India has negated Pakistan's overnight attempts to escalate tension with India by targeting military installations in the northern and western parts of the country.

title: "Any Attack On Military Targets...": Why India Struck Pak Air Defence Today
content: When India struck 24 terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir under Operation Sindoor yesterday, it ensured that no military installation was targeted.

title: 10 Fascinating Facts About The Papal Conclave You Should Know
content: Before the conclave officially begins, all non-electing cardinals and external officials are dismissed with the Latin phrase 'Extra Omnes'.

title: Madhya Pradesh Man Stabbed To Death Over Old Enmity, Video Posted Online
content: A 23-year-old man allegedly slit a person's throat over an old enmity while his accomplice filmed the act and posted the video on social media in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district, police said on Thursday.

title: Watch: Pak's Khawaja Asif Fact-Checked By CNN Anchor Over Op Sindoor Claims
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif once again embarrassed himself and his nation on live television after he was caught spreading misinformation regarding India following successful strikes on nine terror sites in Pakistan and PoK.

title: US Woman's Racist Slur Sparks Outrage And Fundraising
content: A video showing a Minnesota woman at a playground last week openly admitting to using a racist slur against a Black child has garnered millions of views.

title: Trump's Big Teaser Before US-China Trade Talks In Switzerland This Week
content: US President Donald Trump has teased a "very, very big announcement" on Thursday. According to the American commander-in-chief, his upcoming announcement is a "major trade deal" with a "big, highly respected country".

title: NASA Absent From Space Exploration Summit From Delhi, Reason Is...
content: NASA astronauts and scientists were not present at the Global Space Exploration Conference in Delhi, likely a result of the budgets cuts under US President Donald Trump's second term.

title: "Any Military Attack On India Will Get A Firm Response": S Jaishankar
content: The external affairs minister said the "barbaric" Pahalgam terror attack compelled India to carry out strikes on "cross-border" terror infrastructure on Wednesday.

title: Surgeon Loses Job After Doctor Wife Exposes Extramarital Affairs With Juniors
content: A Chinese surgeon was fired and expelled from the Communist Party after he was found having multiple extramarital affairs with several women, including a nurse and a junior doctor at his workplace.

title: Satellite Pics Show How Terror Sites Were Destroyed In Operation Sindoor
content: Satellite imagery released by Maxar Technologies revealed detailed visual evidence of the destruction caused by Operation Sindoor, the unprecedented mission in which airstrikes, precise, pre-planned, and unprecedented in scale, targeted nine sites.

title: "Want To Murder In Name Of Jihad": Asaduddin Owaisi's Call Against Terror
content: Terrorists backed by Pakistan want to commit murders in India in the name of 'jihad', AIMIM leader and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi, calling for a global campaign against The Resistance Front, a Lashkar-e-Taiba front

title: Maid Of Honour Plans To Step Down After Groom's "Controlling, Aggressive" Behaviour
content: A woman asked to be the maid of honour (MOH) by a not-so-close friend is now planning to step down from her role due to the groom's controlling and aggressive behaviour.

title: When Top Court Praised Colonel Sofiya Qureshi Who Co-Led Op Sindoor Briefing
content: The top court had referred to the distinctions achieved by women officers, and put out an example of Colonel Sofiya Qureshi's achievements.

title: "Leaders Showed Maturity, Didn't Bicker": Kiren Rijiju On All-Party Meet: 10 Points
content: Home Minister Amit Shah and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh briefed the opposition on Operation Sindoor, the military reply to Pahalgam. In an early morning strike Wednesday the armed forces hit terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pak-occupied Kashmir.

title: 'Operation Sindoor still ongoing': Rajnath Singh at all-party meet
content: In a recent all-party meeting, the government disclosed that 'Operation Sindoor' resulted in the elimination of over 100 terrorists across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, who chaired the meeting, emphasized the ongoing nature of the operation and India's readiness to retaliate against any Pakistani aggression.

title: 16 killed in Pak shelling; Rajasthan, Punjab on high alert: Key points
content: Tensions escalate along the India-Pakistan border following "Operation Sindoor," a retaliatory strike against terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Indian armed forces targeted LeT and JeM bases with precision weaponry after the Pahagalam attack. In response, the government convened an all-party meeting, led by key ministers, to brief the opposition on the situation and diplomatic efforts.

title: Operation Sindoor: Several airports in India closed - check full list
content: Air travel faces disruption as several Indian airports halt commercial flights due to Operation Sindoor. The closure affects 27 airports across northern, western, and central India until May 10. Airlines like IndiGo and Air India cancel and reschedule hundreds of flights. Passengers are advised to check flight status. Affected airlines offer refunds and rescheduling options. Delhi airport also reports cancellations.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'India is going to ...', says Donald Trump's close ally Laura Loomer in viral post on Twitter
content: Laura Loomer, a far-right activist, wished India good luck. This followed reports about India's Operation Sindoor. Loomer's tweet gained significant traction online. She is known for her controversial views and support for Donald Trump. Loomer has a history of making extreme statements. She has also unsuccessfully run for Congress. She remains a vocal figure in MAGA circles.

title: Fake news alert: Government fact checks 'Pak propaganda' on Operation Sindoor
content: The Indian government's Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked several Pakistani news reports regarding Operation Sindoor, launched by the Indian Armed Forces post the Pahalgam attack. PIB has flagged these reports as "Pakistan sponsored propaganda", including false claims of shooting down Indian Rafale jets and targeting the Srinagar airbase.

title: Military attack by Pakistan will be met with 'very firm response': S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar asserted India's firm stance against any Pakistani retaliation following "Operation Sindoor," a targeted response to a barbaric attack in Jammu & Kashmir. During meetings with Iranian and Saudi counterparts, Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to countering terrorism.

title: Op Sindoor Impact: IPL match to be shifted from Dharamsala
content: The IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians has been relocated from Dharamsala to Ahmedabad due to the closure of Dharamsala's airport, confirmed by GCA secretary Anil Patel. This change has created logistical challenges for Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings, who face a difficult journey from Dharamsala after their game.

title: How this one sentence from top Apple executive wiped away $160 billion from Google’s market value
content: Alphabet's shares plummeted by 8%, erasing $160 billion in market value, after Apple's Eddy Cue revealed they are exploring Safari's search capabilities. Google searches on Safari saw their first decline, attributed to rising AI adoption. Apple plans to integrate AI search options, potentially including OpenAI and Perplexity AI, into Safari.

title: Operation Sindoor Day 2: Nifty50 drops 150 points as tensions escalate
content: Operation Sindoor impact on stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, dipped in trade on Thursday after reports of escalating tensions between India and Pakistan a day after Operation Sindoor.

title: 'I remember ... ': Tendulkar's touching message for Rohit
content: Rohit Sharma has retired from Test cricket. He made the announcement before India's tour of England. Sachin Tendulkar shared an emotional message. Tendulkar gave Rohit his Test cap in 2013. Rohit played 67 Tests and scored 4,301 runs. He captained India in 24 Tests. His last Test was in Melbourne against Australia. He will continue to play ODI cricket.

title: Elon Musk warns 'All life on Earth will be destroyed by...'
content: Elon Musk, SpaceX founder, warns of the sun's eventual destruction of Earth, advocating for Mars colonization as humanity's long-term survival strategy. He emphasizes the urgency of establishing a self-sustaining civilization on Mars, viewing it as "life insurance" for humanity. SpaceX is actively developing plans for Martian habitats and addressing the challenges of establishing a permanent colony.

title: From US to UK: How world leaders backed India's 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK, drawing strong international support. Western allies like the UK, France, and the US, along with Israel and Panama, backed India's right to self-defense against terrorism. Global leaders condemned the Pahalgam attack and urged Pakistan to address the terror threat within its borders.

title: Op Sindoor: 3 explosions rock Lahore, flight ops temporarily halted
content: Following Indian airstrikes on terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, a loud explosion was reported in Lahore, leading to temporary flight suspensions in Karachi, Lahore, and Sialkot. 'Operation Sindoor,' a tri-service mission, targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen infrastructure in response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, asserting India's right to act against cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Maine bhi pilot ki training le rakhi hai': Tej Pratap Yadav offers to serve nation
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan due to Operation Sindoor, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav has offered his services to the nation, highlighting his pilot training. Yadav expressed his willingness to sacrifice his life for the country, stating that he would consider it an honor to serve, as conveyed in his post on X.

title: Operation Sindoor spooks Pak stock market! Trading halted with 6% crash
content: Following India's missile strikes on terrorist facilities, the Pakistan stock market, KSE 100, plummeted over 6%, halting trading. This crash, exacerbated by Operation Sindoor and previous economic measures by India, highlights Pakistan's economic fragility.

title: 'Wait! one player left': MS Dhoni's viral gesture melts the internet
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets, effectively ending the defending champions' playoff hopes. Dewald Brevis's explosive 52 and crucial contributions from Shivam Dube and MS Dhoni secured the victory. In a heartwarming moment, Dhoni's sportsmanship shone as he ensured KKR pacer Chetan Sakariya wasn't missed during the post-match handshakes.

title: Before & after: Satellite images show damage to terror camps in Pak after Op Sindoor
content: Following the deadly Phalgam terror attack, the Indian Army launched 'Operation Sindoor,' conducting precision strikes on nine terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Satellite images reveal substantial damage to key locations, including the Jamia Mosque in Bahawalpur and a LeT training center in Muridke. The operation targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen bases, carefully avoiding Pakistani military installations.

title: Rohit Sharma drops bombshell on his future
content: Rohit ends his red-ball career as one of India’s most dependable batters in the latter part of his journey. He scored 4,301 runs in 67 Tests, including 12 centuries and 18 half-centuries, at an average of 40.57. Having already bid farewell to T20 Internationals after last year’s World Cup win, the 38-year-old will now be seen leading India only in the ODI format.

title: Pakistani intruder gunned down in Punjab's Ferozpur
content: Border Security Force neutralized a Pakistani intruder attempting to cross into India from Punjab's Ferozpur sector. This incident occurred amidst heightened security in Rajasthan and Punjab following India's strikes on terror infrastructure in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Both states have implemented stringent measures, including school closures and increased police vigilance, to brace for potential escalations.

title: Pak minister's bizarre response when asked for proof of downing Indian jet
content: Pakistan's defence minister, Khwaja Asif, faced scrutiny on CNN after claiming Pakistan shot down five Indian jets during Operation Sindoor. He cited social media as his source, drawing a sharp response from the anchor. This followed India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, responding to the Phalgam attack that killed 26 people.

title: Rohit Sharma retires: Why writing was on the wall since Boxing Day Test
content: Single digit outings in Adelaide and early departure in his only innings of the Brisbane Test meant Rohit was done with the middle-order gig. He made up his mind, had that tough talk with Shubman Gill, who had to miss out on a Playing XI spot due to the shuffle, and was back as an opener in front of a capacity crowd at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. India's XI changed, batting order changed but Rohit's returns remained the same. Two more single digits, India lost the Test and pressure on the Indian captain peaked.

title: Borders sealed: Rajasthan, Punjab, Gujarat on high alert after Op Sindoor
content: Following India's strikes on terror launchpads in Pakistan and PoK after the Pahalgam attack, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are on high alert. Public events are cancelled, schools are shut, and security is tightened. Airports face closures and flight disruptions, while railway stations increase surveillance. The nation prepares for potential retaliation, prioritizing civilian safety and readiness in border states.

title: Chahal's latest post for RJ Mahvash goes viral amid dating rumours
content: Yuzvendra Chahal, the Punjab Kings' spinner, is in the news following his IPL hat-trick against Chennai Super Kings. His Instagram message congratulating RJ Mahvash on her show has reignited dating rumors. This follows Mahvash's praise of Chahal's performance, fueling fan speculation. Chahal's match-winning spell, including dismissing MS Dhoni, further intensified interest in his personal life alongside his on-field achievements.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices slip in India to Rs 96,980 per 10 grams
content: Gold rate today: Despite rising global prices fueled by Federal Reserve inflation concerns, gold prices in India declined on Thursday due to upcoming U.S.-China trade discussions.

title: 'Sabko young captain chahiye ... ': Rohit Sharma opens up
content: Rohit Sharma has announced his retirement from Test cricket, ending speculation about his future in the format. The 38-year-old will continue to lead India in ODIs, having already retired from T20Is. Sharma scored 4,301 runs in 67 Tests, with 12 centuries. In a recent interview with journalist Vimal Kumar, Rohit opened up about his journey and the doubts he once had about leading India.

title: Jeweller stabs five people in east Delhi over marital dispute
content: In a shocking incident in east Delhi's Mansarovar Park, a jeweller named Aman Verma attacked his in-laws and father with a knife during a discussion about his marital problems with his wife, Sonam Verma. The jeweller stabbed five people, including Sonam, her brothers, their driver, and his own father, before fleeing the scene.

title: Cancer survivor tops Chhattisgarh Class X boards with 99.2 per cent
content: Ishika Bala, a class 10 student from the Maoist-affected Kanker district, triumphed over blood cancer and emerged as the state board exam topper with an impressive 99.2%. Her success story shines as a beacon of hope in a region with low female literacy. Akhil Sen, the class 12 commerce topper, also hails from Kanker, highlighting the district's academic excellence.

title: US issues travel warning for Jammu and Kashmir after Operation Sindoor
content: Following India's launch of Operation Sindoor targeting terror sites, the U.S. issued a security alert advising citizens against travel to Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes, confirmed by the Indian Ministry of Defense on May 7, 2025, retaliated for a deadly attack in Pahalgam. Pakistan responded with artillery shelling along the LoC, leading to casualties and heightened tensions.

title: AICWA strongly reaffirms ban on Mahira Khan and Fawad Khan for ‘anti-India’ statements
content: Following India's 'Operation Sindoor,' which targeted terrorist bases in Pakistan and PoK, Pakistani celebrities like Mahira Khan and Fawad Khan faced backlash for criticizing India's actions. AICWA responded by banning Pakistani artists from working in India and condemning Indian companies collaborating with them. Several Bollywood stars, including Kangana Ranaut, supported the Indian Armed Forces, praising their operation.

title: Notorious nine in Pakistan & PoK: Why India hit them
content: India executed precision strikes on key terror infrastructure inside Pakistan, targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Muhammed strongholds. The strikes hit training camps and operational headquarters, including Muridke and Bahawalpur, long protected by Pakistan's military-intelligence apparatus. These facilities served as hubs for training, indoctrination, and planning numerous terror attacks against India, including the Pulwama attack, before being neutralized.

title: Govt debunks Pakistan's false 'strike at Amritsar military base' claim
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked Pakistan's false claims of striking an Indian military base in Amritsar, exposing the circulated video as wildfire footage from Chile in February 2024. PIB also refuted claims of shooting down an Indian Rafale jet, clarifying the image was old and unrelated to 'Operation Sindoor.

title: US trade deal: Is UK going to be the first on Trump’s list?
content: US President Donald Trump is set to unveil a significant trade agreement today with a nation speculated to be Britain. This move occurs amidst global economic concerns, as the Bank of England anticipates cutting interest rates. Britain, actively pursuing new partnerships post-Brexit, recently secured a trade deal with India.

title: Astronomers discover giant star-forming cloud, 5,000 times larger than the Sun
content: Researchers discovered Eos, a molecular cloud, using ultraviolet light. It is near Earth and lacks carbon monoxide. This cloud lies on the Local Bubble's edge. Eos's discovery helps understand star birth conditions. Scientists propose a NASA mission named Eos. This mission will chart ultraviolet radiation across the Milky Way. It aims to find more hidden molecular clouds.

title: 6 dead as helicopter crashes in Uttarkashi's Gangnani area
content: A helicopter carrying Char Dham pilgrims crashed near Gangnani in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand, resulting in six fatalities, including the pilot, Captain Robin Singh. One injured passenger was airlifted to AIIMS Rishikesh. The Aero Trans Service Pvt Ltd helicopter, en route from Dehradun to Kharsali near Yamunotri, crashed 200-250 meters down a gorge.

title: 'It is very disappointing': Rohit Sharma on Indian commentary
content: Rohit Sharma retired from Test cricket. He criticized the current state of Indian cricket commentary. Sharma pointed out the focus has shifted from the game to views. He contrasted Indian commentary with that of Australia. Sharma highlighted the negativity aimed at players. He played 67 Test matches and captained India in 24 Tests.

title: The many laurels of Col. Sofiya Qureshi: 15 things you need to know about her
content: Vadodara celebrated Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a third-generation Army officer, for her address on Operation Sindoor. She served as a military observer in Congo, contributing to peacekeeping efforts and earning commendations. Colonel Qureshi led an Indian Army contingent at Force 18 and motivated thousands of students, receiving numerous awards and recognition for her service and dedication.

title: Watch: After 'Operation Sindoor', Eden echoes with patriotic fervour
content: Eden Gardens witnessed a powerful display of patriotism during the KKR-CSK IPL clash, with a moving rendition of "Maa Tujhe Salaam" honoring India's defence forces after "Operation Sindoor". However, KKR's batting faltered after a strong start, as CSK's Noor Ahmad's 4/31 restricted them to 179/6, overshadowing the pre-match patriotic fervor despite Russell's effort.

title: Watch: Jaisalmer’s Sonar Fort goes dark in security drill
content: Following India's strikes on terror launchpads, Sonar Fort in Jaisalmer went dark during a security drill, and Rajasthan's border districts were placed on high alert. Schools were indefinitely closed, and civilian flight operations were suspended at several airports, including Jodhpur and Jaisalmer. Air defence systems were activated, and residents reported increased military activity, reflecting heightened tensions.

title: Bomb threat hits KKR vs CSK IPL match at Eden Gardens
content: A bomb threat disrupted the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) IPL match at Eden Gardens, prompting a police investigation and heightened security. The threat arrived via email amidst national security concerns following the Pahalgam attack, coinciding with India's 'Operation Sindoor' against terror targets. Chennai Super Kings edged out KKR by two wickets in a nail-biting finish, virtually knocking the defending champions out of IPL playoff contention.

title: What's the gold rate outlook for May 8 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold exhibits a strong bullish trend, poised to retest its all-time high near ₹99,700, supported by global uncertainties and central bank demand. MCX Silver demonstrates resilience, bouncing from a key Fibonacci retracement level, and is likely to surpass its previous swing high of 98,800, potentially reaching 1,00,000.

title: 3 Greyhounds commandos killed in landmine blast triggered by Maoists in Telangana
content: In a tragic incident, three junior commandos from the Telangana's Greyhounds anti-Naxal force were killed in a Maoist-triggered landmine blast along the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border. The explosion occurred during a routine area domination exercise in the Mulugu district. This marks the first fatalities for Telangana Police in anti-Maoist operations this year.

title: Watch: Blackout at Amritsar's Golden Temple as lights switched off for mock drill
content: A nationwide civil defence drill, ordered by the Ministry of Home Affairs, included a blackout in Amritsar to assess emergency preparedness. The exercise, part of Operation Sindoor following a terrorist attack, involved switching off lights at key locations, including the Golden Temple, between 10:30 pm and 11 pm. Similar blackouts were observed in other states and cities across India.

title: MS Dhoni’s CSK end 6-year wait to break unwanted record
content: Already out of the playoff race, Chennai Super Kings played party-poopers as they pulled off a thrilling two-wicket win over Kolkata Knight Riders, effectively knocking the defending champions out of contention on Wednesday. Chasing 180, CSK crossed the finish line with two balls to spare. Dewald Brevis set the tone with a blistering 52 off just 25 balls, while Shivam Dube chipped in with a crucial 45. Skipper MS Dhoni remained unbeaten on 17, steering his side to victory in a tense finish.

title: 'Great player for India but ... ': Ganguly on Rohit's Test retirement
content: Sourav Ganguly lauded Rohit Sharma, following Sharma's Test retirement announcement on Wednesday. Ganguly highlighted Sharma's significant contributions to India's trophy wins and leadership. Sharma, aged 38, played 67 Tests, amassing 4,301 runs with 12 centuries. Despite home dominance, he faced overseas challenges, though he shone in the 2021-22 Pataudi Trophy in England, marking a high point in his Test career.

title: Final NBA 2K25 Flash Pack brings Howard, Giannis, more to the court
content: 2K Games is getting ready to wind things down in the NBA 2K25 . the final Flash Pack drops on may 7 . more than 19 cards with 100 OVR and more than 55 cards with 99 OVR can be pulled .

title: How the kick change -- MLB's hottest new pitch -- has kick-started the Mets' rotation
content: the kick change is a changeup-splitter hybrid that has surged in popularity . megill is the odd man out of the Mets' rotation since debuting in 2021 . he has a few obvious things in common .

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players: Wilson is No. 1, but where do Collier, Stewart, Clark land?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is here, with preseason games underway and the regular season set to tip May 16 . a'ja Wilson and the Las Vegas Aces have a bit of a new look but remain confident in their core . caitlin Clark is looking to lead the Indiana Fever into title contention .

title: NBA playoff futures: Warriors odds dip following Curry injury news
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers have the third-best odds to win the finals . but they fell from 5-1 to 10-1 following Tuesday's loss to the Indiana Pacers . they are now the favorites in the series at -190 and move from 30-1 to 15-1 .

title: Valentina Shevchenko and Demetrious Johnson make GOAT case ... for each other
content: shevchenko has ruled the 125-pound division for a great majority of the division's eight-year existence . she will face manon Fiorot in this weekend's co-main event in Montreal . the 37-year-old has been matched with a new dance partner .

title: What Pickens trade means for Cowboys, Steelers -- and Aaron Rodgers
content: the move closes the books on pickens' three-year career in the Steel City . the move is a shattered post-NFL draft quiet . he's offered a new opportunity in the Dallas Cowboys .

title: 'Annoyed' Arteta says best team in UCL 'are out'
content: alejandro Moreno slams arsenal for their dependence on set pieces after their exit . the gunners won 2-1 on goals from Fabián Ruiz and Achraf Hakimi to complete a 3-1 aggregate victory . a 69th-minute penalty for a handball by myles Lewis-Skelly was awarded on VAR review .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Knicks rally to take a 2-0 lead back to MSG
content: the Knicks beat the Celtics 121-112 in the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis with a 121-119 victory . Golden State defeated the No. 6-seeded Minnesota Timberwolves 99-88 .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Lookman, Mbeumo, Gittens
content: Atalanta flyer Ademola Lookman tops a three-man shortlist of targets . the gunners are looking to sign Kevin de Bruyne as a back-up right-wing option . click here for all the latest transfer news, transfer news and gossip .

title: Suspected Nipah case reported in Kerala’s Malappuram
content: 42-year-old woman from Valanchery in Malappuram admitted to hospital with Nipah symptoms such as fever and convulsions

title: Operation Sindoor: Special prayers in mosques across Karnataka on May 9, says Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan
content: Special Friday prayers would be held in all mosques under the jurisdiction of the Waqf Board, as well as other mosques in Karnataka, for the well-being and strength of India’s soldiers.

title: Pakistan intruder shot dead by Border Security Force along International Border in Punjab
content: The intruder was found purposefully crossing the International Border in the dark night of May 7-8, 2025

title: Pakistan’s overnight attempt to attack neutralised, says Defence Ministry
content: In response to the Pakistan action, the Indian Armed Forces targeted Air Defence Radars and systems at “several locations in Pakistan” on the morning of May 8, the Ministry added

title: Any military attack on India will be met with very firm response: EAM Jaishankar
content: This attack compelled us to respond on May 7 by striking at the cross-border terrorist infrastructure. Our response was targeted and measured, says EAM S. Jaishankar

title: Alert sounded in sensitive areas, Karnataka following Central guidelines, says CM Siddaramaiah
content: The Karnataka CM said that all guidelines issued by the Centre were being complied with and security has been beefed up at vital installations like dams, as part of the enhanced security protocols.

title: Class 12 Board exam results: Pass percentage of prisoners in T.N. is 92.31
content: For the academic year 2024-2025, 130 prison inmates, including two women, from Central Prisons and Special Prisons for Women across the State appeared for the Class 12 public exams

title: Rahul sought Parliament session so that good message goes outside: Kharge on all-party meet
content: If a session is called, MPs can put forward their views and enhance the confidence of the people, says Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Supreme Court praised Colonel Sofiya Qureshi in 2020 ruling on Permanent Commission to women Army officers
content: The officer broke the glass ceiling when in 2016, she became the first female officer to lead its contingent on the multi-national field training exercise, Exercise Force 18, hosted by India for interoperability in sustaining peace among the ASEAN nations

title: Iran's Foreign Minister repeats call for restraint in India-Pakistan standoff
content: "We hope that India and Pakistan will prevent the escalation of tension in the region," Mr. Araqchi said, reiterating calls for restraint

title: T.N. Cabinet reshuffle: Duraimurugan allotted law portfolio; Regupathy now Minister for Natural Resources
content: An official communication from the Raj Bhavan said the change in portfolios was made based on the recommendations of Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin

title: Private firm employee allegedly assaulted by cab drivers over parking dispute at Bengaluru international airport
content: The victim had parked his car at the arrival terminal, when a few KSTDC cab drivers reportedly approached him and asked him to move the car. It later led to verbal and physical altercation.

title: Priyank Kharge directs officials to prepare action plan to improve SSLC and PUC results in Kalaburagi
content: The minister said the poor SSLC and PUC examination results highlighted the need for immediate attention and intervention to uplift the academic quality in the district.

title: IIM Raipur MBA in Public Policy 2025: Fully funded program with ₹50,000 monthly stipend – apply by May
content: The Chhattisgarh Government will fully sponsor the program by covering the entire tuition fee for enrolled students, ensuring accessibility to quality education.

title: Traffic suspended on Jammu-Srinagar NH after mudslide, flash floods in J&K’s Ramban
content: Vehicular movement on the highway, the only all-weather road linking Kashmir with rest of the country, was suspended at 7.30 a.m. due to multiple mudslides and shooting stones between Seeri and Nachlana

title: How a Malayali ‘chenda’ ensemble performed with Hanumankind at Coachella
content: Kochuveettil Beats, founded by Jeffrey Kochuveettil and Jonathan Kochuveettil, performed chendamelam alongside rapper Hanumankind at the music festival last month

title: Govt briefs all-party meeting on 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah, S. Jaishankar, J.P. Nadda and Nirmala Sitharaman represented the government, while Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge from the Congress, Sandip Bandyopadhyay of the TMC and DMK's T.R. Baalu were among the leading Opposition figures in the meeting

title: Hours after Operation Sindoor, Saudi Arabia’s Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Adel Al-Jubeir arrives in Delhi and meets Jaishankar
content: In the backdrop of Operation Sindoor, Saudi Arabia’s Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Adel Al-Jubeir visits India emphasising on counter-terrorism efforts

title: Kerala steps up security amid India-Pakistan tensions
content: Security beefed up around vital installations in Kerala, including airports, Vizhinjam port, railway stations, naval and air bases in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram, and other main institutions such as the shipyard and LNG terminal in Kochi

title: If I can do anything to help, I will be there: U.S. President Trump on tensions between India, Pakistan
content: Oh it’s so terrible. My position is I get along with both. I know both very well and I want to see them work it out. I want to see them stop and hopefully they can stop now, says U.S. President Trump

title: Vijayawada MP Sivanath seeks CBI probe into liquor scam
content: ‘There has been growing public outrage and demand for transparency over how such a massive scam involving State resources and public health went unchecked,’ says Kesineni Sivanath

title: Char Dham Yatra: Six, including five women, dead as helicopter ferrying pilgrims crashes in Uttarakhand
content: As per information from the Uttarkashi Police, the helicopter crashed on the Rishikesh-Gangotri National Highway at around 8:45 a.m.

title: Vision plans for all Assembly constituencies will be ready by next month, says A.P. CM
content: Thematic reports will be ready by June, and sectoral roadmaps by September, say officials; plans are afoot to introduce a dedicated Population Management Policy

title: Schools shut across border districts in Punjab and Rajasthan following 'Operation Sindoor'
content: All government and private schools in the border districts of Rajasthan including Barmer, Bikaner, Sri Ganganagar and Jaisalmer have declared a holiday until further notification.

title: How Popes Choose Their Names And What's Its Significance
content: the pope's name is often the first message to the world about who he intends to be, the legacy he honours, and the direction he hopes to steer the Church . the practice of adopting a new name began with Pope John II in 533, born Mercurius . he changed his name to avoid pagan connotations associated with Mercury .

title: Symbol row: focus on local body polls, SC tells Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh told senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for Shiv Sena (UBT), the matter could be taken up only after the court’s summer break due to the paucity of time.

title: AgustaWestland case: Delhi HC reserves order on Christian Michel’s plea to relax bail conditions
content: Mr. James, a British national currently lodged in Tihar Jail, appeared before the court via videoconferencing. He requested a relaxation of two key bail conditions: furnishing a ₹5 lakh surety and surrendering his passport.

title: More than a ride: Book captures the soul of Bengaluru’s bus commutes
content: Compiled by a team of writers and volunteers, the book showcases vignettes of connection and community experienced aboard the city’s public buses

title: Pakistan’s complex web of terror networks
content: Pakistan’s terror infrastructure has survived for decades within its security establishment, which views these forces as strategic assets. Pakistan has been placed on and off the Financial Action Task Force ‘grey list’ since 2008 for failing to dismantle terror financing networks

title: Kin of Pahalgam terror attacks hail the retaliatory strikes
content: Family members of the Pahalgam terror attack victims expressed gratitude to the forces for the “swift and fitting response”.

title: Orthopaedic surgeon Soundarapandian passes away at 94
content: Dr. Soundarapandian was born in Thoothukudi on July 4, 1931, and completed his MBBS degree from the Stanley Medical College and MS General Surgery and MS Orthopeadics from the Madras Medical College (MMC).

title: Mock drills conducted, border areas in Rajasthan on high alert
content: Acting on the Union Home Ministry’s directives, the mock drills were carried out in as many as 28 cities across the State

title: Mock drill held in eleven districts of Bihar and Jharkhand
content: As drills were conducted against the backdrop of Operation Sindoor, political leaders in Bihar and Jharkhand cut across the party lines, and praised the actions of the Army.

title: Operation Sindoor LIVE: Pakistan’s retaliatory attack thwarted, says Defence Ministry
content: The Ministry of Defence said, “It has been reliably learnt that an Air Defence system at Lahore has been neutralised”

title: Mock drills conducted in 5 M.P. districts; BJP, Congress praise Armed Forces
content: Drills, reviewed by CM Mohan Yadav, followed ‘Operation Sindoor’ retaliatory strikes against sites in Pakistan and PoK; State leaders united in support of military action.

title: Pahalgam victims’ in Bengal feel a weight lift after Operation Sindoor attacks
content: The wife of a BSF trooper, Purnam Kumar Sahu, being held by Pakistani forces had contrasting sentiments on the operation as she awaited news of her husband

title: Security tightened in Punjab; Himachal reviews security and communication systems
content: Many pilgrims arrived at the Kartarpur corridor on May 7 morning to offer prayers at the gurdwara in Pakistan but were asked to return

title: Shelling by Pakistani troops in J&K's Kupwara, Baramulla, Uri and Akhnoor areas
content: The Pakistani side targeted civilian areas in the Karnah area, firing shells and mortars after midnight, officials said

title: Blackout drill resumes in Amritsar, residents asked to remain indoors
content: Taking utmost caution, the Amritsar district administration has again started the blackout drill, said a message shared by the Amritsar District Public Relations Officer

title: SC assures communication of CJI’s action on inquiry panel report on Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The information followed a submission of a confidential report by the SC in-house committee probing the discovery of half-burnt currency at Justice Yashwant Varma’s official Delhi residence after a fire in March

title: Terror will be tracked and punished, says J&K L-G
content: L-G Manoj Sinha lauds armed forces’ precision strikes; reviews security, directs relocation of civilians from vulnerable areas

title: Kashmir calm, but fear is palpable among the locals
content: We pray the situation does not spiral out of hand, it’s Kashmir that always pays the cost of a war, let sanity prevail and peace follow, said a local

title: Sambhal court issues notice to Rahul Gandhi for remarks on RSS, BJP
content: On January 15, Mr. Gandhi alleged that the BJP and the RSS had ‘captured every institution of the country,’ adding, ‘We are now fighting the BJP, the RSS, and the Indian state itself.’

title: Operation Sindoor: Loitering munitions used against terror bases developed in Bengaluru
content: Loitering munitions, which are also known as suicide or Kamikaze drones, are developed by a Bengaluru-based private company which has a joint venture with an Israel-based military technology company

title: Pondy Bazaar’s multilevel car park ticks all boxes, yet remains underused
content: Most of the shoppers either pay ₹60 per hour for cars or ₹15 per hour for two-wheelers to park along the Pondy Bazaar stretch for convenience or simply because they are unaware of the MLCP

title: After brief hiatus, Chennai to receive Krishna water supply from A.P. in a few days
content: Andhra Pradesh authorities had suspended water supply to the city in view of the repair work that was being carried out on the sluice gate of Kandaleru Poondi canal near Kalahasti

title: Construction of bypass to reduce traffic congestion in Tirupattur town begins
content: The four-lane stretch, to come up on the Tirupattur-Singarapettai High Road, will be an alternative route for long-distance travellers to go to places such as Dharmapuri, Salem, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Operation Sindoor: Pakistan authorises armed forces to take ‘action’ after strike
content: In an emotional address to the nation Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif vowed to “avenge every drop of blood” for dozens of Pakistanis believed to have been killed in the attacks by India

title: One dead, nine injured after aircraft crash in Punjab village
content: Crash site in Bathinda district cordoned off; authorities yet to confirm details of unidentified aircraft

title: Supreme Court asks why permanent mechanism cannot be put in place to conduct CLAT like NEET
content: The apex court pointed to “casual manner” in framing CLAT 2025 questions, issued notice to Education Ministry, and recalled its 2018 judgment flagging persistent organisational flaws in the exam.

title: Election Commission tells Supreme Court it will not erase data from EVMs slotted for verification
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna and Dipankar Datta was hearing a plea which had contended that the SOP framed by the poll body was not in tune with the April 2024 judgment of the apex court in the EVM-VVPAT case

title: Operation Sindoor: Govt calls all-party meet; Cabinet lauds military strikes
content: According to sources, the Prime Minister lauded the ‘perfect’ operations carried out by the armed forces; Congress hopes that Mr. Modi will attend the all-party meet after having skipped the earlier meeting in the aftermath of Pahalgam terror attack

title: Will resolve FMG issues at the earliest, says medical council Chairperson
content: Four-member panel, including APMC members and Director of Medical Education, formed to look into the issues of Foreign Medical Graduates, including granting of Permanent Registrations

title: Cabinet allocate more funds to five IITs, new scheme for ITIs
content: Cabinet clears ₹11,828 crore for expanding the IITs; greenlights ₹60,000 crore ITI upgrade scheme to skill 20 lakh youth

title: NIA asks tourists, locals to share info related to Pahalgam terror attack
content: The National Investigation Agency urges public cooperation in probe; appeals for photos, videos, and eyewitness accounts of Pahalgam attack

title: India briefs envoys of 13 Security Council members
content: Briefing of 13 envoys from the UNSC as part of a larger strategy to counter Pakistan at UNSC, 1267 terror listing and FATF

title: South CMs, victims’ families hail ‘Operation Sindoor’ as measured response to Pakistan
content: Chief Ministers, Opposition leaders express solidarity with armed forces; families of April 22 victims call strikes ‘befitting’

title: Political leaders across Uttar Pradesh hail armed forces for Operation Sindoor
content: Cross-party support for Army’s counter-terror strike; CM Adityanath, Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav laud response to Pahalgam attack

title: More firms from Tamil Nadu foray into warehousing space
content: Increasing demand for storage and logistics space is encouraging more businesses to venture into this sector

title: Operation Sindoor: Qatar, Spain and other global powers call for de-escalation
content: Qatari PM and Foreign Affairs Minister Al-Thani calls External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and his Pakistan counterpart; other leaders too hold telephonic conversations
